reference.shortdesc: Provides information about the type of all buckets, or whether they are active or replica.

section.title: Syntax
section.codeblock: cbstats [localhost]:11210 vbucket cbstats [localhost]:11210 vbucket-details [vbid] cbstats [localhost]:11210 vbucket-seqno [vbid]
section.p: These requests are used as follows:

ul.li: vbucket: Lists all available vBuckets and provides information about their type: active or replica.
vbucket-details: Uses the option VBID or vBucket ID to provide details about a specific vBucket.
vbucket-seqno: Uses the option VBID or vBucket ID to provide details connected to the vBucket's sequence number. This has to be verified, it's just my guess.

section.title: Description
section.p: The vbucket command shows whether a vBucket is an active or a replica vBucket.

row.entry: Number of active items in memory.
Number of temporary items in memory.
Total memory used in disk queue.
Total enqueued items on disk queue.
Total drained items on disk queue.
Total VB state snapshots persisted in disk.
Total memory used by meta data.

section.title: Examples
section.codeblock: vb_0: replica vb_1: replica vb_10: replica vb_100: active vb_1000: replica vb_1001: replica vb_1002: replica vb_1003: replica vb_1004: replica vb_1005: replica ...
